title: Kamala Harri VP pick disappoints some who hoped for a new milestone : the first Jewish vice president
message:
Republicans, meanwhile, tried to paint Harris’ choice as a snub to Jewish voters, a traditionally Democratic constituency that former President Donald Trump has tried to court in this year’s race.
“I defy any one of them to name a single Jewish Republican governor or a single Jewish Republican U.S. senator.
They can’t, because there are none.”The last Jewish Republican senator was former Sen.
Only 30% of Jewish voters supported Trump in 2020, while 69% supported Biden, according to AP VoteCast, a sweeping survey of the electorate.
That made Jewish voters one of the religious groups where support for Biden was strongest.

title: Some Democratic backers of Josh Shapiro see a missed chance for a Jewish vice president
message:
Josh Shapiro speaks before Democratic presidential nominee Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate Minnesota Gov.
Josh Shapiro, who was one of Harris’ finalists for the job and seen as someone who could help Democrats win a key swing state and make history by electing the first Jewish vice president.
“I defy any one of them to name a single Jewish Republican governor or a single Jewish Republican U.S. senator.
They can’t, because there are none.”The last Jewish Republican senator was former Sen.
“That’s just called stewardship and accountability.”Most Jewish Americans vote Democratic and are still poised to rally around the Democratic ticket, even without Shapiro.

title: Minnesota Jewish leaders highlight VP pick Tim Walz platform
message:
With Shapiro, as the second Jewish Vice Presidential nominee in history, came antisemitic attacks over his support of Israel.
Walz," Roberts said.
Shapiro," Roberts said.
Walz has an understanding of rural and urban America, two important things Kieffer Leonard said have been missing from the Democratic Party.
"Certainly expressing some of the most important principles with respect to the Jewish community, and Israel and antisemitism."

title: Harvard Campus Disruptions | Harvard Magazine
message:
That would require training faculty members on new teaching methods and educating the community about religious literacy.
The details of implementation will be telling, and its effect assumes the public distinguishes between a Harvard voice and those of individual community members.
Beyond the headline issues, faculty members feel unconsulted on matters ranging from Harvard’s investment in Allston and decisions about budgets to worries about political and donor pressures on campus discourse.
Unfortunately, such concerns radiate beyond student and faculty views of the campus culture and parameters for speech and protest.
’98 (for the 350th, in 1986), still resonate:…Here, imagineA spirit moves, John Harvard walks the yard,The books stand open and the gates unbarred.

title: We are the underdog : Harris introduces running mate Walz as a coach , veteran and protector of reproductive rights
message:
‘We are the underdogs’: Harris introduces running mate Walz as a coach, veteran and protector of reproductive rightsPHILADELPHIA — Vice President Kamala Harris introduced her running mate to the nation at a raucous rally in Pennsylvania’s biggest city Tuesday, playing up Minnesota Gov.
Thousands of supporters roared as Harris and Walz alternated between playing up his bio and taking shots at former President Donald Trump and his running mate, Sen. JD Vance, R-Ohio.
Vice President Kamala Harris and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz (Pete Kiehart for NBC News)“I set out to find a partner who can help build this brighter future,” Harris said.
She shouted out that Walz “was known as one of Capitol Hill’s best marksmen, winning a bipartisan sharpshooting contest year after year.”“I’m telling you, Tim Walz will be ready on Day One,” she said.
But Tim Walz, he’s good.”Earlier in the day, Vance campaigned in Philadelphia.

title: Kamala Harris : We are the underdogs , but we have momentum
message:
Kamala Harris: We are the underdogs, but we have momentumKamala Harris and Tim Walz made their debut at a rally in Philadelphia - Getty ImagesKamala Harris described herself and Tim Walz as “the underdogs” in the race to defeat Donald Trump as she introduced her running mate to supporters in Philadelphia on Tuesday night.
Harris and Walz embrace - ReutersThe pair clasped hands as Ms Harris grinned and, with her other hand, pointed at Mr Walz to the cheering audience.
Kamala Harris and Tim Walz - Reuters11:03 PM BSTCheers as Harris and Walz walk on stageBeyonce’s song “Freedom” played before an announcer introduced Kamala Harris and Tim Walz as “the next president and vice president of the United States”.
“Let me tell you about my friend, Kamala Harris, someone I’ve been friends with for two decades.
Tim Walz and Kamala Harris are true public servants who have spent their lives working tirelessly on behalf of the American people.

title: Kamala Harris : We are the underdogs , but we have momentum
message:
Harris and Walz embrace - ReutersThe pair clasped hands as Ms Harris grinned and, with her other hand, pointed at Mr Walz to the cheering audience.
Kamala Harris and Tim Walz - Reuters11:03 PM BSTCheers as Harris and Walz walk on stageBeyonce’s song “Freedom” played before an announcer introduced Kamala Harris and Tim Walz as “the next president and vice president of the United States”.
“Let me tell you about my friend, Kamala Harris, someone I’ve been friends with for two decades.
Commenting on the choice of Mr Walz he added: “My view on this is it just highlights how radical Kamala Harris is.
Tim Walz and Kamala Harris are true public servants who have spent their lives working tirelessly on behalf of the American people.
